website_summaries.verdict: The Oppo PM-3 is an impressive headphone -- both in terms of build and sound quality -- but just how impressive you think it is will depend on what music you feed it and from what source.
pros: The Oppo PM-3 is an affordable planar magnetic headphone that's well-built, attractively designed, relatively comfortable, and optimized for use with mobile devices
The headphones deliver high-fidelity sound and come with a nice carrying case as well as a bonus cable for cell-phone use (you choose between an Android or iOS inline remote)
For a closed-back headphone, sound is spacious
cons: Reveals flaws in poorly recorded or grittier sounding tracks (plays best with lossless/high-resolution files)

customer_reviews.title: Literally cried spontaneous tears of joy during my first evening listening with these
customer_reviews.text: Literally cried spontaneous tears of joy during my first evening listening with these. The clarity of sound is spectacular, and the quality of the silence is exceptional. They're not too ostentatious for the commuter train, but they're really best at home when you can appreciate the subtleties.
customer_reviews.author: Christina L. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing balance of sound and practicality
customer_reviews.text: These are the best-built and best-wearing headphones I've purchased, and I've purchased about 10 headphones in this price range over the past 2 years. They've balanced portability, durability, comfort, and sound amazingly well. If you feel you can afford them, buy them.

So very disappointed especially considering the price paid! Might sound good, but won't last and the company seems to also agree :(
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, and well-constructed
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous, comfortable, and well-constructed, the Oppo PM-3 is delightful right out of the box. Sound performance is slightly warm, with the oft-mentioned high-end rolloff, but wonderful. If you want a brighter, more clinical sound (for half the money, albeit with a lower build quality), go for the Audio Technica ATH-MSR7. But why can't I change my own ear pads? What if I wanted real leather or memory foam? Or a bigger cup for my awkward sticky-outy ears? At the price, this is my only gripe. Honestly though, it isn't worth detracting a star.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: The pleather will inevitably fail no matter how well you care for them

Having recently retrieved them, the pleater is just in tatters and falling apart at an increasing rate. Very disappointing for 4-year old headphones I hoped would last decades. Just miserable quality. But hey, the sound is amazing until they disintegrate all over you.

customer_reviews.title: Well built, good sounding headphones with useful extras
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. One caveat: they don't seal perfectly around the ears, unless you have small ears, but they do well enough that I can hear very quiet passages while someone else is doing something noisy in the next room. Thus I didn't take away any stars. As they are sealed, no one else can hear what I am hearing which helps when watching Formula 1 on the iPad while the wife watches something on the TV. The second cable is a great addition too. They also fold nice and flat into the case which does make them more portable than the headphones I take to work. Like I said at the start, great headphones!

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are excellent for that long plane flight or sleeping
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed these headphones was an old person with old people ears. They captured the vocal and instrument sound perfectly. These headphones are excellent for that long plane flight or sleeping. Not recommended for anyone who likes bass-heavy music. I hooked them up to my soundboard while a local rock band was playing and did not like what I "didn't hear." The sound was light and clear leaving me unimpressed. I would not recommend product unless you are a vocalist or fan of classical music. If you are, you would love this product.

With the PM-3, users can easily recreate the experience of listening to a pair of flagship headphones on a flagship amplifier or a high quality 2-channel speaker system in an optimized listening room, but in a portable form factor that can be taken anywhere. The closed-back nature of the PM-3 provides isolation from the outside world, blocking out the surrounding noise while avoiding sound leakage from the headphones.
